results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Cherine Fahd (Touch: a family portrait)
results.brief_description:
The 30-second moving image for the Neighbours project is titled Touch ‘ A Family Portrait. It is a portrayal of a family greeting each other on Christmas Eve. The 30-second edit concentrates on the family’s overwhelming display of affection towards each other, their intense ‘kissing’ and ‘touching’. The camera/edits jump from one person to the next, as they kiss from cheek to cheek and affectionately embrace, whilst all speaking at once.

It portrays a multi-racial (Lebanese, Australian, American) family whose affection is displayed and celebrated and whose cultural identity exists beyond the stereotypes of multiculturalism. This piece functions as an antidote or as a somewhat more realistic alternative to the tokenistic portrayal of non-Anglo Australians, in television productions such as ‘Neighbours’.

Neighbours (the remix) - Katrina Sawyer (Decent, generous, tolerant, open minded [white] people)

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Brook Andrew (Hail Amerika)
results.brief_description: The new work for Neighbours (the remix) is obvious in nature. It repeats American logo. In Australia, I find my life pervaded by Amerikanism. My art practice comments on Amerikanisation within Australian and the world culture and mediums, so with all the current world domination attitudes by Amerika, it pops up again. This time like a resounding hammer bashing down hard on the little people who have no power but to listen and bob heads, ‘yes…I do’. Fear is translated through our determination to buy McDonalds and waver in American soapies, news and perspectives.

results.title: Negro slavery
results.brief_description: The decision of the English colonists in the seventeenth century to use Africans as slaves would eventually challenge the most fundamental tenets of American life. This film analyses the institution of slavery, shows how it came to divide the nation, and how it helped to create some of the tensions that exploded in to the Civil War.

results.title: Negotiation for positive results
results.brief_description: A training video with accompanying trainer’s manual that provides techniques to aid people in the workplace in developing a positive and bias-free approach to negotiation. The program takes participants through the steps necessary for a thorough approach to negotiation, a process that considers both parties in arriving at a result of mutual benefit. It stresses the need to consider the environment in which negotiations take place, and to ensure that all elements of prejudice are put aside.

results.title: Negotiating a new Canadian constitution
results.creator_credit: Gordon Payne, John Taylor, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A visually fascinating and mildly ironic look at the Canadian people, this three-minute film is an animated version of a poem by Lionel Kearns. It is experimental in nature and well-stocked with brilliant graphics and an unusual sound track.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol.2
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation by John Patrick Dolan shows the tactics and countertactics of effective negotiations, such as why silence is such a powerful tool, how to use and respond to the “wince” tactic, and simple ways to defuse emotional outbursts and disarm hostile attacks!

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 4
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation by John Patrick Doolan looks at how to get what you want from negotiations. What you’ll learn includes ways to make your brainstorming sessions even more productive, dealing with emotional outbursts at the bargaining table and avoiding the 13 mistakes amatueur negotiators make.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation with John Patrick Dolan looks at what to do when things break down. Learn the main reason negotiations break down, and how to prevent it, when arbitration is a good idea and how to negotiate a deal from a weak position.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 1
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! Presented by John Patrick Dolan, this seminar outlines the keys to effective deal making. Negotiation means getting what you want in a way that is fair and respectful to the all parties. Stressing the importance of skills such as the the basics of setting ground rules before beginning, listen first, talk last, how to use questions as crowbars why and how to focus on your interests as opposed to your your position and the one thing not to divulge during any negotiation this video will help you become the negotiator you’ve always dreamed you could be!
